creator: bob.stone@hp.com
text:
line 210:
String name = xmlRpcConfiguration.getAttribute("name");

use wrong instance of Configuration and will return an empty string, which will 
not be caught by the line 211
if (name != null) // should you also check here for an empty string?

As a result SAX parser load will fail

And the actual bug fix is

line 210:
String name = xmlRpcDriverConfiguration.getAttribute("name");

And I would also use the following instead (just in case)
String name = xmlRpcDriverConfiguration.getAttribute("name", "xerces");

creator: Kevin.Ross@iVerticalLeap.com
text:
dup of 20544, but valid by the way.  it is now resolved.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 20544 ***

I hate to be anal, but the check (name != null) is entirely useless as the 
underlining code will return an empty string rather than null, plus it would be 
nice to provide some default, which xmlRpcDriverConfiguration.getAttribute
("name", "xerces") method happily does.
creator: bob.stone@hp.com
Kevin.Ross@iVerticalLeap.com
text:
there are now defaults upon defaults.  if xerces doesn't end up as the driver, 
let me know.
